alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 2:38PM PST until March 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY... At 238 PM PST, flooding continues across the warning area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, with isolated locations having received upwards of 6 inches of rain. While the heavy rain has ended, the risk for flooding will continue. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from earlier heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Grover Beach, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, Santa Margarita, Lake Lopez, Oceano, Avila Beach, Templeton, and Cayucos. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
